title: HELP!!! Need to ID these two fonts for big project!!
content:
Been trying to ID these two fonts for the past 2 weeks and sadly still blank :( Any help will be much appreciated!!!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Leica-logo-C5B9F8426D-seeklogo.com\_.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022031914/http:/typophile.com/files/Leica-logo-C5B9F8426D-seeklogo.com_.gif) | 2.27 KB |
| [logo\_zinkia.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022031914/http:/typophile.com/files/logo_zinkia.jpg) | 9.83 KB |
author: Fontie432

comments.content:
"Leica" is an old, custom logo and I'm not sure your 'll find an associated font (at least not in digital format) - maybe you should look for something similar.

"zinkia" must be **[Xyperformulaic Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022031914/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=T-26&ffam=Xyperformulaic2.1%20SB%20-%20Regular&fid=a91e1765df5f9de7a1e2ac19502ef714&fsize=60&text=zinkia&wrap=2)** by Matius Gerardo Grieck (T-26, 1997)  
with a bit modified /z

-----------------------------------------------  
I found it using Find my Font - [http://www.findmyfont.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022031914/http:/www.findmyfont.com/ "http://www.findmyfont.com")
there's a previous thread on this somewhere....

I just found it (and marked as duplicate):  
 [http://typophile.com/node/102289#comment-552051](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022031914/http:/typophile.com/node/102289#comment-552051 "http://typophile.com/node/102289#comment-552051")
BIG BIG THANK YOU!!! Have a great day!!
